title: Air Fryer Baked Potatoes Recipe
description: A baked potato in the air fryer comes out beautifully crusty on the outside and fluffy on the inside. It's what a great baked spud should be, and so easy!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Everyday Cooking Cooking by Equipment Air Fryer Side Dishes Air Fryer Baked Potatoes 4.7 (74) 64 Reviews 8 Photos A baked potato in the air fryer comes out beautifully crusty on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside, just what a great baked potato should be! Serve them with your favorite toppings, like sour cream, butter, or chives. Submitted by Bren Updated on January 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 2 Yield: 2 baked potatoes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 2 large russet potatoes, scrubbed 1 tablespoon peanut oil ½ teaspoon coarse sea salt Directions Gather all ingredients and preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Brush potatoes with peanut oil, sprinkle with salt, and place them in the air fryer basket. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook potatoes until very tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip The potatoes do not need to be pricked with a fork before cooking or turned while cooking. I Made It Print 127 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 344 Calories 7g Fat 65g Carbs 8g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 344 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 1g 6% Sodium 462mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 65g 23% Dietary Fiber 8g 29% Total Sugars 3g Protein 8g 15% Vitamin C 73mg 81% Calcium 44mg 3% Iron 8mg 45% Potassium 1557mg 33% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Air Fryer Baked Potatoes 01 of 08 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 08 Photo by  Earlene 07/23/2021 The baked potato was so simple. Washed and patted dry the potato and rubbed olive oil over potato and sprinkled salt. Baked at 400 degrees for 1 hour. Added some favorites such as butter, pico de gallo, sour cream and a sprinkle of sliced green onions. A perfect meal! 03 of 08 Photo by  Howard 11/30/2020 Awesome Recipe Bren! 04 of 08 Photo by  Amber Taylor 05/04/2020 05 of 08 Photo by  aida 01/04/2020 06 of 08 Photo by  Deb C 09/02/2019 I followed the recipe exactly and it came out with a fluffy interior and crispy exterior. The air fryer is perfect when you don't want to heat the whole oven. 07 of 08 Photo by  Bert 04/12/2019 08 of 08 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 08/18/2018 Perfect as written! The shell gets so crispy but the inside is nice and fluffy. My husband said it was the best baked potato he has ever had. He even ate the entire peel which is unlike him. I guess I know how I will be preparing baked potatoes from now on. 5 star recipe all the way! name: Bren
instructions: Gather all ingredients and preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Cook potatoes until very tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
